item.title: 2017: Year in Review
item.description: I am trying to make these posts a tradition (even if a few days late). I thought 2016 had been a really weird and fun year, but 2017 has beaten it easily. And I only hope 2018 will be even better in every way. For the record, when I say we, it means Laia and me unless explicitly changed.

item.title: October Kafka London Meetup - Jay Kreps: Distributed stream processing with Apache Kafka
item.description: This has been the first time I could attendÂ the Apache Kafka meetup in London.Â Previous meetings had me in Barcelona or flying. First realisation: it is aÂ surprisingly crowded meetup! Clearly, everyone is using Kafka, even if it is notÂ clear from the outside. Oh, and the food was pretty good, too. Thanks to theÂ sponsor (which I have sadly forgotten). I really enjoyed this one. The speaker was Jay Kreps, CEO and co-founderÂ of Confluent (and authorÂ of I Heart Logs), so, basically, a Kafka top committerÂ himself.
